intro: Cylindrocline, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a member of the Rutaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Australia, where it thrives in dry, sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in yellow or greenish hues. Cylindrocline is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
